body.p:
Your umbal petioner Caloway Marcum states that at the April Term of the Lawrence Circuit Court 1859 there was a judment rendered aganst him for $50 00/100 and cost and he state to your worshup that since that time he has unfortunatly got shot in the Knee with a gun which renders him unholy able to perform any kind of Laber and he is intirely without any means of subsitens and with any kind of means to pay the same and to Execute the Law the officer would have to take me and deliver me to the jailer there to be confined for one Hundred day rendering me miserabl and disgrasing me for Ever the offersers will releas there costs and your umble petitioner would ask and dos ask you to remit the fine as to hold it aganst him would not profert the State any thing and the offence will wateit a resonable time to hear from you before they deliver me to the Jailer my relative is not able to pay the fine and are hardly able to give me some thing to Eat or they would pay it for me -- if it had not hapened that I got Shot I would not have asked for you to
interposed and remited the fine but as it is I umbly ask it of you and only ask it of you will be thankful

I would just state that he is un able to work and I have no doubt will remain so from the Shot mention and is not able to pay the same and will releas the Cost that is coming to me and it would be an act of charity to releas the fine

You &c
M B Goble C L C C
I told Mr Marcum that it was unnessery to get a hole roture of signers to his petition that the fact was prperly Stated and I had no doupt you would remit the same without that

Lawrence Cir Ct
Remitted
B M
$50
C. Marcum
Issd Jany 22 1861
